text: jeremysevareid: Did you see my attempt to put all of the use-cases in a consolidated page? It's right on the "Requirements WG" wiki page
Did you mean creating a table or something?
Retiring the other pages and consolidating into a table. I've got the table in progress.
Am using a combination of your page and the dashboard for table
I'd love to see the "Requirements WQ" be the landing place - it's the easiest one to find with Google
oleg: Is the current status of the use-cases reflected in the main page? I heard on the call a number of use-cases got to milestone 1, but the status didn't get updated

attachments.title: hyperledger/hyperledger
attachments.text: Hyperledger Project is a new Collaborative Project at The Linux Foundation. The technical community is just getting started and will be adding code to the repository in the coming weeks. Check hype...

text: think we should advertise them on the main page once they're at M2
<@U14KZA474>: second the table idea; need to show commonalities between use cases
<@U0ULQ2G5V>: So what you're saying is that the organisation work I did on the Requirements WG page has been duplicated on the dashboard page, and I should stop?

attachments.title: hyperledger/hyperledger
attachments.text: Hyperledger Project is a new Collaborative Project at The Linux Foundation. The technical community is just getting started and will be adding code to the repository in the coming weeks. Check hype...

text: So I think the issue is that the wiki format doesn't play well with the type of slice/dice/variable ways of looking at the long list of use cases we have
We've got lists by industry, status, submission block, etc.
Everyone wants to look at it in a different way
I suspect this is going to happen again
I think we need something like a datatable.js or similar and/or punt to google sheets as GitHub wiki tables are extremely limited in functionality and formatting from what I can tell
